attr_labels.dateTime: When this  Consent was issued / created / indexed.
attr_labels.provision.data.reference: A reference to a specific resource that defines which resources are covered by this consent.
attr_labels.verification.verifiedWith: Who verified the instruction (Patient, Relative or other Authorized Person).
attr_labels.provision.provision.class: The class of information covered by this rule. The type can be a FHIR resource type, a profile on a type, or a CDA document, or some other type that indicates what sort of information the consent relates to.
attr_labels.provision.period: The timeframe in this rule is valid.
attr_labels.provision.provision.provision: Rules which provide exceptions to the base rule or subrules.
attr_labels.provision.actor.role: How the individual is involved in the resources content that is described in the exception.
attr_labels.provision.actor.reference: The resource that identifies the actor. To identify actors by type, use group to identify a set of actors by some property they share (e.g. 'admitting officers').
attr_labels.provision.provision.securityLabel: A security label, comprised of 0..* security label fields (Privacy tags), which define which resources are controlled by this exception.
attr_labels.provision.purpose: The context of the activities a user is taking - why the user is accessing the data - that are controlled by this rule.
attr_labels.provision.provision.actor.role: How the individual is involved in the resources content that is described in the exception.
attr_labels.provision.provision.code: If this code is found in an instance, then the rule applies.
attr_labels.provision.provision.data: The resources controlled by this rule if specific resources are referenced.
attr_labels.patient: The patient/healthcare consumer to whom this consent applies.
attr_labels.provision.provision.period: The timeframe in this rule is valid.
attr_labels.scope: A selector of the type of consent being presented: ADR, Privacy, Treatment, Research.  This list is now extensible.
attr_labels.provision.data.meaning: How the resource reference is interpreted when testing consent restrictions.
attr_labels.provision.provision: Rules which provide exceptions to the base rule or subrules.
attr_labels.provision.provision.purpose: The context of the activities a user is taking - why the user is accessing the data - that are controlled by this rule.
attr_labels.policy.uri: The references to the policies that are included in this consent scope. Policies may be organizational, but are often defined jurisdictionally, or in law.
attr_labels.provision.class: The class of information covered by this rule. The type can be a FHIR resource type, a profile on a type, or a CDA document, or some other type that indicates what sort of information the consent relates to.
attr_labels.provision.provision.data.meaning: How the resource reference is interpreted when testing consent restrictions.
attr_labels.verification: Whether a treatment instruction (e.g. artificial respiration yes or no) was verified with the patient, his/her family or another authorized person.
attr_labels.policy: The references to the policies that are included in this consent scope. Policies may be organizational, but are often defined jurisdictionally, or in law.
attr_labels.identifier: Unique identifier for this copy of the Consent Statement.
attr_labels.provision.type: Action  to take - permit or deny - when the rule conditions are met.  Not permitted in root rule, required in all nested rules.
attr_labels.performer: Either the Grantor, which is the entity responsible for granting the rights listed in a Consent Directive or the Grantee, which is the entity responsible for complying with the Consent Directive, including any obligations or limitations on authorizations and enforcement of prohibitions.
attr_labels.provision.provision.actor: Who or what is controlled by this rule. Use group to identify a set of actors by some property they share (e.g. 'admitting officers').
attr_labels.provision.provision.actor.reference: The resource that identifies the actor. To identify actors by type, use group to identify a set of actors by some property they share (e.g. 'admitting officers').
attr_labels.provision.data: The resources controlled by this rule if specific resources are referenced.
attr_labels.provision.code: If this code is found in an instance, then the rule applies.
attr_labels.provision.provision.data.reference: A reference to a specific resource that defines which resources are covered by this consent.
attr_labels.provision.securityLabel: A security label, comprised of 0..* security label fields (Privacy tags), which define which resources are controlled by this exception.
attr_labels.policy.authority: Entity or Organization having regulatory jurisdiction or accountability for  enforcing policies pertaining to Consent Directives.
attr_labels.policyRule: A reference to the specific base computable regulation or policy.
attr_labels.provision: An exception to the base policy of this consent. An exception can be an addition or removal of access permissions.
attr_labels.provision.provision.dataPeriod: Clinical or Operational Relevant period of time that bounds the data controlled by this rule.
attr_labels.organization: The organization that manages the consent, and the framework within which it is executed.
attr_labels.provision.actor: Who or what is controlled by this rule. Use group to identify a set of actors by some property they share (e.g. 'admitting officers').
attr_labels.provision.provision.type: Action  to take - permit or deny - when the rule conditions are met.  Not permitted in root rule, required in all nested rules.
attr_labels.provision.dataPeriod: Clinical or Operational Relevant period of time that bounds the data controlled by this rule.
attr_labels.category: A classification of the type of consents found in the statement. This element supports indexing and retrieval of consent statements.
attr_labels.status: Indicates the current state of this consent.
